results.title: Little athletics: sprinting
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Skills and exercises needed for successful sprinting are explained and demonstrated in this film. These include techniques of body movement, relaxation and also the methods of starting and running the race. This film is interspersed with some shots of Australian women sprinters. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia

results.title: Little athletics: long jump
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Two young athletes are coached in the techniques of long jump. Shows both the sail jump, popular with young jumpers, and the hitch kick used by most successful long jumpers. Demonstrates exercises to build up the long jumper’s strength and flexibility. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia

results.title: Little athletics: hurdling
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: The stages of learning to hurdle are explained and demonstrated. Specific exercises for hurdlers are shown along with more general exercises from which all young athletes could benefit. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia

results.title: Little athletics: high jump
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: A young athlete is taught the Fosbury Flop. The run-up, take-off and landing are explained in detail. Includes a series of exercises relevant to high-jump. Gordon Windewyer, an Australian and Commonwealth champion, is seen in action using the Fosbury Flop. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.description: A young athlete is taught the Fosbury Flop. The run-up, take-off and landing are explained in detail. Includes a series of exercises relevant to high-jump. results.title: Little athletics: discus throwing
results.creator_credit: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Alan Launder coaches two athletes through the initial stages of discus throwing. A more advanced technique is demonstrated which is applicable to senior athletes. Safety measures are stressed for class teaching. Exercises to help build up strength and flexibility have been included. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Blane, Australian Little Athletics Union and Shell Company of Australia

results.title: Literacy and common sense (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open College of Further Education (S. Aust.)
results.brief_description: Don Holdaway demonstrates a lesson in literacy with primary school children. Discusses his teaching methods and how they can be adapted to suit most classroom situations. Author of set text “Foundations of Literacy”.

results.title: Listen up with Norm Crosby
results.brief_description: Explores causes of hearing loss due to excess noise experienced in modern living. Various ways of reducing the possibility of long-term damage are suggested.

results.title: Listen to us - the way we speak. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Barbara Wethey and Inner London Education Authority
results.brief_description: Part 1. “Listen to us”: “Linguistic and Cultural Diversity”. Britain now has a multi-ethnic and multicultural society which is also multilingual. This program acknowledges that diversity in order to benefit pupils. Part 4. “The Way We Speak”: “Considering Dialect and Learning”. Considers whether schools should permit and teach dialects of the English language. In both of these programs we see activities which may help to develop and reinforce language, showing teachers using the activities in actual classrooms. Companion videotape “Working Together in the Classroom; Supporting Understanding”

results.title: Lisa Curry's pregnancy workout
results.creator_credit: Jeff Hogan, Leigh Gower and Carol Lloyd Corporate Theatre
results.brief_description: The golden girl of Australian swimming, Lisa Curry presents this personal pregnancy workout program - a professionally planned and directed series of aerobic-styled exercises you can do each day in the privacy of your own home. Filmed in the Sunshine Coast waterfront home Lisa shares with husband, Grant Kenny - surfing “iron man” and Olympic canoeist -“Lisa Curry’s pregnancy workout” covers a wide range of pregnancy health and fitness topics of assistance to all expectant parents.
